header.type: HUMAN RIGHTS VIOLATIONS, SUBMISSIONS QUESTIONS AND ANSWERS

testimony: We will proceed to the lady next to Mr Jali.  Your full names madam please.
Who are you going to talk about?
I am going to talk about my husband, April Pika.
Will you briefly tell us what happened to your husband?

The boers came, took him, beat him up, kicked him, threw him on the floor.   They threw him into a police van and took him to town.   He was detained for two days in town and then he came back.  He was terribly injured.
He got injured when they were beating him up.
According to your statement Mrs Pika you say that they used the back of the gun to beat him up.

You say that they were using guns, they would kick him with their boots, slap him on the face, throw him on the floor.  That ill-treatment caused his illness.
 On his release he was never able to do anything constructive again until he passed away.
If I am not mistaken he passed away in 1985, according to the documents here.
You speak about a child with epileptic fits.  Whose child is that?
Do you remember what you said about this child?
I remember you spoke about this child.

Could you repeat please.  What did you say about the child.   According to your statement you said your child should be given a sickness grant.  Is there something else you would like to say, madam?  Maybe you have something to say.
